sentence.Network_en: The tree has gnarled red branches and deep green leaves.
sentence.Network_cn: 这棵树的树枝扭曲多瘤且呈红色，树叶则是深绿色。

sentence.Network_en: The fingers were gnarled, lumpy, with long, curving nails suggestive of animal claws.
sentence.Network_cn: 手指粗糙，关节突出，指甲又长又弯，让人想起动物的爪子。

a gnarled oak , branch , trunk ., 多节瘤的橡树 , 树枝 , 树干.

list.abs: ...排列几乎呈水平状。釉柱自釉质牙本质界至牙表面的行程并不完全呈直线，近表面l/3较直，而内2/3弯曲，在切缘及牙尖处绞绕弯曲更为明显，称为绞釉(gnarled enamel)釉柱的直径平均为4-6μm。纵剖面可见有规律间隔的横纹(fig.4,5)，横纹之间的距离约为4μm，相当于釉基质每日形成的量。横纹处矿化程度稍低，故当牙轻度脱矿时.
synthesis of organic carboxylate using modified gnarl catalyst ., 改性片麻岩为催化剂合成有机羧酸酯的研究.
what then , you may ask , is a gnarled walker ?你也许就会问了，多节行者是什么？
every gnarled hack knows that the best way to bury bad news is counter it with a splashy announcement .每个政坛老手都知道掩盖坏消息的最好方法就是同时宣布一个引人注目的好消息。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: variant of knarled, from knar

entry.tran: （树）多节瘤的，扭曲的，疙疙瘩瘩的
entry.def: A gnarled tree is twisted and strangely shaped because it is old.

example.ex: ...a large and beautiful garden full of ancient gnarled trees.
example.tran: 长满了扭曲盘错的古树的漂亮大花园

entry.tran: 长满皱纹的；皮肤粗糙的；关节扭曲的
entry.def: A person who is gnarled looks very old because their skin has lines on it or their body is bent. If someone has gnarled hands, their hands are twisted as a result of old age or illness.

example.ex: His hands were gnarled with arthritis.
example.tran: 他的双手因患关节炎而扭曲变形。

means.word_mean: 1. used of old persons or old trees; covered with knobs or knots;

auth_sentence.content: You get gnarled leaves and stems all twisted.

auth_sentence.content: The birches here are fat, even a little gnarled.
